content: for this pattern that is always one stitch you will always work a full pattern repeat never a partial repeat work the final stitch as shown in the chart 4 @thestitchling cuff note you may find the introduction to magic loop german twisted cast on and setting up your magic loop videos helpful for this section using the german twisted cast on loosely cast on 53 57 61 65 69 73 77 81 stitches using your mc if you struggle to cast on loosely you can cast on with a 2 25mm us 1 needle and then slide the stitches onto a 2mm us 0 needle ready to knit fold the cable of your 2mm us 0 needles in half so that the two needles are next to each other and then cast on around both needles slide one needle free ready to knit note to arrange your needles for magic loop position the first 13 14 15 16 17 18 19 20 stitches on the left needle place the central 26 28 30 32 34 36 38 40 stitches in the middle of the cable position the final 14 15 16 17 18 19 20 21 stitches on the right needle this means that whilst working the glove your bor won t be at the weak point where you pull the cable through but in the centre of one of the two sets of stitches ensure that the stitches are not twisted join in the round slip the first stitch on the left needle onto the right needle purlwise pass the last cast-on stitch over and off as though binding off return the slipped stitch to the left needle gently pull the working yarn to tighten the join place bor marker you should have 52 56 60 64 68 72 76 80 stitches on your needles ribbed cuff rolled cuff rounds 1-12 all stitches worked in mc rounds 1-8 all stitches worked in mc knit *knit 1 purl 2 knit 1* repeat until bor arm you have finished the cuff and will now join your cc to start working the arm s colourwork chart note the faux seam is created by always knitting the first and last stitch of the round in the mc there are some row where all of the other stitches are worked in the cc and you will need to carry your mc from the first stitch to 25 the final stitch i recommend catching your floats after six stitches when there are two of these 24 23 row together make sure you catch your floats at different points to avoid your mc being visible on 22 21 the rs for the row worked entirely in the mc you do not need to carry your cc 20 19 rounds 1-2 all stitches worked in mc knit to bor 18 17 rounds 3-4 knit 1 stitch in
